Name: Definition of employer for purposes of the human rights law.
Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the definition of employer for purposes of the human rights law.

History.Description: This Introduction was Introduced by Council
This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Civil Rights
This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
This Introduction was Laid Over by Committee
This Introduction was Sine Die (Filed, End of Session)

Text:
Be it enacted by the Council as follows:

Section 1.  Subdivision 5 of section 8-102 of the administrative code of the city of New York, as amended by local law 39 of 1991, is amended to read as follows:
(5) [For purposes of subdivisions one, two, and three of section 8-107 of this chapter, the term “employer” does not include any employer with fewer than four persons in his or her employ.]  The term “employer” includes every employer regardless of the number of persons in his or her employ.  For purposes of this subdivision, natural persons employed as independent contractors to carry out work in furtherance of an employer’s business enterprise who are not themselves employers shall be counted as persons in the employ of such employer.  
§2. This local law shall take effect immediately.
--------
JEB
6/13/11
LS #1638
